thread.title: Zouk agrees to sale to Genting Hong Kong for undisclosed sum
thread.title_full: Zouk agrees to sale to Genting Hong Kong for undisclosed sum - Channel NewsAsia

author: - CNA/wl
title: Zouk agrees to sale to Genting Hong Kong for undisclosed sum
text:
SINGAPORE: Genting Hong Kong (GHK) will buy Singapore club Zouk for an undisclosed sum, in an acquisition that was sealed on Monday (Oct 19).
In June, the club's management said that it would leave its Jiak Kim Street premises and move to a new location at Clarke Quay by the third quarter of 2016, after it had difficulties renewing its lease. At that time, there was talk about Zouk being sold.
GHK, which also operates Star Cruises, is headquartered in Hong Kong. It is an affiliate of the Genting Group, and has a secondar listing in Singapore. Genting Singapore is part of the group.
The iconic club was set up by Mr Lincoln Cheng, 68, in 1991, and became a global name with its range of musical styles and stream of visiting international deejays. The club also organises the annual ZoukOut dance festival in December and has another branch in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
- CNA/wl
